snippet: Many people were fearful that the army could not repel an attack on Maiduguri by the Islamist militants, who have taken over other cities in the region.
abstract: Hundreds of thousands of people flee Maiduguri, Nigeria, amid fears that militant group Boko Haram is closing in on the city; successful attack by the Nigerian army on Maiduguri, birthplace of Boko Haram and major commercial and government hub, would represent a significant advance.
lead_paragraph: Many people were fearful that the army could not repel an attack on Maiduguri by the Islamist militants, who have taken over other cities in the region.

headline.main: As Islamist Militants Advance, Residents Flee a Nigerian City
headline.print_headline: As Islamist Militants Advance, Residents Flee a Nigerian City
